content:
Tracking time spent on tasks is an essential aspect of project management. While Trello doesn't have a built-in time tracking feature, there are several ways to log time in Trello or integrate with other tools that offer time tracking capabilities. Here are a few options:

**1. Trello Power-Ups:**

* **Trello Timer**: A free Power-Up that allows you to track time spent on tasks directly within Trello. You can start and stop the timer, and the time will be logged on the card.
* **Harvest**: A time tracking and invoicing Power-Up that integrates with Trello. You can track time spent on tasks, and Harvest will sync the data with your Trello cards.
* **Toggl**: A popular time tracking Power-Up that allows you to track time spent on tasks, projects, and clients. Toggl integrates seamlessly with Trello.

**2. Browser Extensions:**

* **Trello Time Tracker**: A browser extension that adds a timer to your Trello cards. You can start and stop the timer, and the time will be logged on the card.
* **Clockify**: A free browser extension that allows you to track time spent on tasks across multiple platforms, including Trello.

**3. Third-Party Integrations:**

* **Trello + Harvest**: Integrate Harvest with Trello to track time spent on tasks and sync the data with your Trello cards.
* **Trello + Toggl**: Integrate Toggl with Trello to track time spent on tasks and projects.
* **Trello + Clockify**: Integrate Clockify with Trello to track time spent on tasks and sync the data with your Trello cards.

**4. Manual Time Logging:**

If you don't want to use a Power-Up, browser extension, or third-party integration, you can still log time manually on each card using comments or a custom field. This approach requires more effort, but it's a viable option if you don't need automated time tracking.

Choose the method that best fits your team's needs, and you'll be able to track time spent on tasks in Trello efficiently.
